title: Rio Tinto profits slump on iron ore collapse
text:

Thu, Aug 6, 2015, 08:55 BST - UK Markets close in 7 hrs 35 mins Rio Tinto profits slump on iron ore collapse By Bloomberg | Telegraph – 9 minutes ago +0.99 
A slowdown in China is hitting commodity prices 
Rio Tinto Group, the world’s second-biggest mining company, reported a 43pc drop in first-half profit this morning after iron ore prices collapsed because of a global glut and a slowdown in China’s steel industry. 
Underlying profit fell to $2.9bn in the six months through June, from $5.1bn a year earlier, London-based Rio said in a statement on Thursday. 
The world’s largest mining companies are confronting a China-led slowdown in commodities demand that’s crimping prices and hurting profits and shares. 
The price of iron ore delivered to the Asian nation averaged about 46pc less than a year earlier, curbing earnings for top suppliers including Brazil’s Vale SA, Rio Tinto (LSE: RIO.L - news ) and BHP Billiton (NYSE: BBL - news ) . 
Rio shares have declined 14pc this year and slumped to a six-year low on July 27. 
The stock rose 3.9pc on Wednesday to close at 2,567.50p, valuing the company at about $46.7bn.
